alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Madison; Marshall; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:41PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Jackson, northern Marshall, southern Madison and northeastern Morgan Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 441 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southeastern Huntsville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Huntsville, Redstone Arsenal, Owens Cross Roads, Grant, Gurley, Woodville, Paint Rock, Farley, Trenton and Garth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
